This is it, isn't it? The Zone takes another one...
I don't want to go out like this... Not like this...
I thought I could beat this place... I was a fool...
If I go, stalker... promise me you'll live...
The Zone has no mercy, and neither does death...
Stalker, don't let me die here...
I don't want to die... not like this... not now...
The Zone always wins, doesn't it? Fucking hell...
Why did I think I'd survive this place? Why?
If this is it... make it quick... please...
Everything's going dark... fuck...
Stalker, run! Don't let the Zone take us both...
Bleeding out here in this hellhole... fitting end, huh?
If you've got any mercy, just finish it...
Blood's pouring out... can't... can't stop it...
This place is gonna be the death of me...
If I fall, stalker... burn this cursed place to the ground...
No one survives the Zone... not really...
I can't die here... I can't...
The Zone always wins... always...
Everything's fading... Is this... death?
Stalker, help me! I don't want to die!
Everything hurts... God, everything hurts...
If you've got any decency, don't let me die here...
The Zone's gonna claim another one... fucking perfect...
I thought I'd be different... I thought I'd make it...
This isn't how it was supposed to end...
The Zone's laughing at me... I can hear it...
If I go, stalker... don't let them forget me...
The Zone's gonna take me... isn't it?
Stalker... don't let my death be meaningless...
All that I've done... and it ends like this...
Zone, you cruel bitch... you win...
If I go... make it quick, stalker...
It wasn't supposed to end like this... Fuck...
The Zone's laughing at me... I can hear it...
Not like this... please, not like this...
If this is how it ends... so be it...
Stalker, I'm begging you... don't let me die here...
The Zone always wins... doesn't it?
Everything's going dark... shit...
The Zone's got me... and it's not letting go...
I should've left this place while I still could...
The Zone doesn't forgive... never...
If this is the end... I'm ready...
Shit... my vision's going dark...
Stalker... run... don't let the Zone take us both...
Bleeding out in this hellhole... fitting end, huh?
If you've got any mercy, just finish it...
Blood's pouring out... can't... can't stop it...
The Zone's gonna claim another one...
Don't let my death be in vain...
It's cold... so fucking cold...
My chest burns... I'm... fuck...
All my plans... ruined by this cursed place...
Help me... or at least kill me quick...
If I fall, tell them I fought...
Not like this... I still have so much...
Bleeding out... not like this...
Cold... too cold...
Fuck this place... fuck it all...
Stalker... this isn't fair...
Everything... hurts...
Zone... you've won...
If I survive this... I'll never return...
So much pain... why...
This Zone... always...
Run... while you can...
If this is it...
Stalker... do it...
Never thought...
Hurts...
I'll fight till...
Just leave me...
No! Still...!
One more shot...
Tell my name...
Can't... go...
The birds seem restless. Are there buildings nearby?
Stalker, look. There, the sky in the distance. Does that storm look normal to you?
Did you feel that? Small tremors in the ground? I don't see a pseudogiant nearby...
I have a bad feeling about this. Where are all the mutants?
Hey, the clouds are starting to quickly stir!
Do you hear that?
The CNPP is in that direction, right? In the distance?
I'm feeling lightheaded...
Am I crazy? There is no breeze in the air.
Shh! Shh! Do you hear that?
The air feels... wrong. Like it's pressing down on us.
That sky isn't right... something big is coming.
Everything's gone too quiet... I don't like this at all.
The animals are fleeing... something bad is about to happen.
Look at the horizon—those clouds are moving too fast...
Do you feel that hum? It's like the Zone is holding its breath...
I think we're in for a surge... better find cover, fast.
The CNPP... it's waking up again, isn't it?
The Zone's restless... this isn't going to end well.
I can feel it in my teeth... that vibration... you feel it too?
The animals are running, the birds are gone... This can't be good.
Shit, look at the sky! That's not a normal storm...
I don't like this... we need shelter, now!
My head's pounding... like something's drilling into my skull.
The Zone's about to unleash hell... I can feel it.
Where are all the mutants? They're usually everywhere...
That rumble... it's coming from deep underground, isn't it?
The sky... it's like it's alive, swirling and boiling...
I think I hear it... that low hum... it's getting louder...
Do you feel that? The ground's shaking, just a little...
Something's coming... and it's not good.
The Zone doesn't like us being here... it's about to remind us why.
I feel sick... like something's trying to tear me apart from the inside.
The pressure... it's like the air's trying to crush me...
That storm's too fast, too sudden... it's no ordinary weather.
Look at the sky... the colors are all wrong...
Stalker, we need to move... find a shelter... now.
It's like the Zone's alive... and it's angry.
The animals are gone, the air's heavy... this is bad.
I've seen this before... just before an emission hits...
That sound... it's coming from the CNPP, isn't it?
Everything feels off... like the Zone's about to break loose...
It's too quiet... the Zone's never this quiet...
The birds are gone... that's never a good sign...
The Zone's stirring... can't you feel it?
That's no storm... it's something far worse.
I don't like this... the Zone's too quiet right now...
It's coming... the Zone's about to unleash hell...
I can feel it in my gut... something big is about to happen...
The Zone's waking up... and it's not in a good mood.
Stalker, look at this. The hairs on my arms suddenly stood upright...
Is your PDA acting strange too? I just bought new batteries a day or so ago.
Do... do you hear that faint siren?
We should probably hurry. That doesn't look like a normal storm on the horizon.
One of my buddies just messaged me. They said a psi-storm is forming over their location!
There were stalkers talking about a psi-storm earlier, but I can't remember when. Do you?
I think my compass is broken. Look, it's spinning faster and faster!
Did you just hear those Pulse anomalies? They're happening back to back, in the distance.
That's strange. The screen on my artefact detector is really bright. There can't even be that many anomalies around us...
Huh? My RF receiver turned on by itself. I don't know how, I took the batteries out for my headlamp.
My head feels like it's splitting open... Is it a psi-storm?
The air feels charged... like static crawling over my skin.
Did you see that flash? No lightning, just... a pulse in the air.
The Zone feels alive... and pissed off.
That sound... it's faint, but it's there... like whispers on the wind.
My PDA's glitching like crazy... this can't be good.
The horizon's glowing... that's not normal.
Something's messing with my head... I can feel it.
Stalker, we need shelter—now. Psi-storms don't give second chances.
The Zone's playing tricks on me... or is it?
That hum... it's getting louder... it's in my skull...
The animals are losing their minds... look at them scatter!
The sky looks like it's boiling... what the hell is going on?
Pulse anomalies are flaring up everywhere... this can't be good.
The static in the air... it's making my teeth ache.
I swear I heard voices... faint, but... they're out there.
It's like the Zone's trying to mess with our heads...
My artefact detector's going crazy, but there's nothing here...
That horizon glow isn't natural. Stalker, we're in trouble.
Why does it feel like the air is alive? Like it's watching us?
That hum is inside my head... I can't shake it...
Something's coming, stalker. Something we can't fight.
The Zone's restless... it's building to something big.
My RF receiver's picking up static... but no signals. What the hell?
The horizon's glowing like the sun's setting... but it's not.
Feels like the Zone's crawling under my skin...
That glow on the horizon... it's pulsing, like a heartbeat...
The Zone's always dangerous, but this... this is something else...
Stalker, I don't like this... we need to move.
Whatever this is, it's not natural... not even for the Zone.
That whispering sound... it's getting louder...
Even the mutants are hiding... that's never a good sign.
Why's my head spinning like this? What's happening?
My compass is freaking out... just spinning non-stop...
The air's thick... it's like I can barely breathe...
My PDA's screen just flashed white... what the hell is going on?
The Zone's alive tonight, stalker... and it's angry.
This isn't a normal storm. We need shelter, now.
The ground feels like it's humming... can you feel it?
The sky's swirling like it's alive... and it's not natural.
[Your companion's last moments are spent choking on their own blood, clawing at the ground. Desperately, they try to cling to life before their body grows still. They have been lost to the Zone.]
[As life begins to fade from your companion's eyes, they reach out to you for comfort in their final moments. Though they have accepted their fate, they do not wish to die alone, here, in the Zone.]

[Try as you may, there is little you can do for your companion's wounds. Tears begin to stream down their cheeks, body gradually slumping while contemplating the meaning of it all. Such is the fate of many, in the Zone.]

[Despite your companion's assurance that they can continue, it is clear that they are in shock from injuries sustained. They grow weary from the loss of blood, eyelids becoming heavy. An ally is forever lost as their eyes close one last time. It is a better end than most within the Zone]

[Your companions' eyes grow wide with shock as the realization dawns on them – death approaches. However, they embrace it, welcoming the opportunity to escape from this hell. There is a certain peace in knowing that you no longer have to struggle to survive, in the Zone.]

[With an outstretched hand, your companion musters the last of their will to hand you something. A letter to a loved one? An item of personal significance? Perhaps the location of a hidden stash? Regardless, they succumb to their injuries before you can question it. Broken promises and failed duties alike are plenty, within the Zone.]

[You approach your companion with hesitation, knowing full well that their state is grievous. They manage a bloodied chuckle, assuring that there are no regrets in the time spent travelling at your side with a smile. Together, you briefly reminisce. Together, you have endured and witnessed much. But, now, it is their time to depart. Friend or foe, it matters not to the Zone.]

[Before you realize it, your companion has fallen in the struggle. Be it from bullets from a weapon or the fangs of a mutant, their warm and lifeless corpse is reminder off how fickle life truly is for all, in the Zone.]
I'm... sorry... I'm sorry... I'm... so... sorry...
I want to go home... I want... to go home... I want... to... go...

[As you reach your companion, their body is already limp, blood pooling around them. Their last words are drowned by the gurgle of blood, leaving only the silence of the Zone to accompany their passing.]
[Your companion's body shudders violently as they attempt to hold on to life. With one last gasp, their eyes fixate on the sky, searching for a mercy that will never come.]

[A faint smile crosses their lips as they look at you one last time. Their voice trembles with faint laughter as they mutter, "Guess it's your turn now, stalker..." before the light leaves their eyes.]
[Your companion's final breath escapes their lips in a sharp, ragged exhale. The Zone claims another, leaving only their cooling body as a testament to their struggle.]
[With a weak grip, they cling to your arm, their eyes pleading for reassurance. "Don't let it be for nothing," they whisper before collapsing into your embrace, gone.]
[Your companion collapses mid-stride, their hand clutching a photo of loved ones. As the Zone takes them, their final words are a plea to deliver the photo to safety.]
[They laugh bitterly, spitting blood. "The Zone wins again, huh?" Their head tilts back, eyes glazing over as their struggle ends.]
[Even in their final moments, your companion curses the Zone with their last breath. Their body stiffens as life fades, leaving only resentment in the air.]
[Their breathing slows as they grab your collar. "Stay alive, stalker... for both of us." Their grip weakens, and the Zone claims another.]
[Eyes wide with terror, they scream into the void, fighting until their body collapses. Their fear lingers in the air as a chilling reminder of the Zone's cruelty.]
[Their voice trembles, "I was so close to getting out... so close..." They slump forward, their dream of escape shattered in an instant.]
[Blood pools beneath them as they weakly reach for your hand. "Don't let the Zone... take you too." Their hand falls limp as they succumb.]
[They cough violently, trying to speak. No words come, only their eyes filled with desperation before they close forever.]
[In their final moments, they stare into the distance, whispering names you do not recognize. The Zone's grip tightens, and they are no more.]
[A single tear escapes as they whisper, "Tell them I didn't give up." The Zone silences them, and their story ends.]
[Their body spasms before going still, leaving you to wonder if there was anything more you could have done.]
[They weakly smile at you, mouthing "Thank you," before their head tilts to the side, lifeless.]
[Their last words are drowned by a blood-chilling scream as the Zone takes its due.]
[You watch helplessly as their body trembles one final time. Their eyes fixate on you, filled with regret, before closing forever.]
[Their voice is barely audible. "Live for me, stalker..." They collapse, leaving you to carry their memory.]
[In their final moments, they manage a weak laugh, "At least I didn't die to a boar." Their smile fades as the Zone claims them.]
[They grip their weapon tightly, even as life leaves them. "Keep fighting..." Their body slackens, their struggle over.]
[Their last breath escapes in a quiet, bitter laugh. "The Zone... always wins..." And then they are gone.]
[They claw at the ground, desperate to stay alive, but the Zone doesn't forgive. Their body grows still.]
[A faint smile crosses their lips as they close their eyes. "At least I'm free now," they whisper before succumbing.]
[Their final moments are spent staring at the sky, whispering, "Maybe... it's better this way." Their voice fades, and so do they.]
[A single tear rolls down their cheek as they mutter, "Tell my story..." before going still forever.]
[Even as life leaves them, they manage to curse the Zone one last time. Their voice fades, and they are gone.]
[Their body shakes violently as they try to fight death. The struggle ends abruptly, leaving only silence.]
[They whisper a name you don't recognize before falling silent. The Zone takes another soul.]
[A weak laugh escapes their lips. "Guess I won't make it out after all..." Their eyes close, and they are gone.]
[Their gaze turns to you one last time. "Don't let it take you too..." They slump, lifeless.]
[They fall, whispering a final, "Good luck..." before the Zone claims them.]
[Their body goes limp in your arms, leaving you with the cold truth of their loss.]
[Their final moments are spent cursing their fate, their voice fading as they succumb.]
[They manage a final smile. "Don't forget me..." And then they are gone.]
[Their last breath is a defiant laugh at the Zone, refusing to give it satisfaction.]
[Their grip on your arm tightens briefly before falling away. "Live, stalker..." They are gone.]
There's an old research institute here. It's heavily occupied by the military. With a Hind flying overhead, only an idiot with a death wish would think to raid the place in broad daylight.

Rumors say that the swamp to the northwest is where Bandits set ambushes for those coming in and out of Yantar. I wasn't surprised to hear that Sakharov had Mercenaries watch the place a few weeks ago. They started shooting anybody that wasn't an Ecologist or traveling with one.
The military and their damn helicopters always put me on edge. How can they tell who's who from all the way up there?
I was scrolling through my PDA and I noticed a lot of stalkers have reported dozens of anomalies in the area. Did you bring your detector? We might find something while we're here.

Some stalkers have said that the legendary Strelok once infiltrated the nearby institute, that there is actually a giant laboratory underground and he fought his way through it! I wonder what he found down there?
Agroprom used to be a research hub before the Zone swallowed it. Now it's a battlefield between Duty and the military. Add a few mutants, and you've got the perfect nightmare.
The underground here is infamous. Some say Monolith has an interest in it, but Duty keeps a strong presence to secure whatever lies beneath.
Heard about the bloodsuckers near the marsh? Those swamps are teeming with anomalies too. Stalkers call it a deathtrap for a reason.
The institute is a fortress of sorts. The military runs patrols day and night, and there's always that damn chopper overhead. Getting caught out in the open here is a death sentence.
Duty and the military don't always see eye-to-eye. Rumor has it, Duty's been trying to leverage their presence here to claim the underground labs for themselves.
Ecologists sometimes hire Mercenaries to escort them through the marshes, but even they avoid the area near the Bandit ambush points. A quick buck isn't worth dying for.
The marshes northwest of here are deadly, even by Zone standards. Bandits, bloodsuckers, and anomalies—it's got it all. You'd have to be crazy or desperate to venture out there alone.
Ever wonder why the military is so interested in this place? They say there's something hidden in the institute's underground levels—something worth killing for.
I've seen stalkers hauling strange devices out of the labs here. Whatever's down there, it's valuable enough to risk your life for.
There's always gunfire coming from the southwest. Bandits and loners are constantly clashing near the marshes. It's like a never-ending turf war.
Duty claims to protect the Zone from chaos, but here in Agroprom, they seem more interested in what's underground than keeping mutants at bay.
The anomalies here are strange. Some seem to shift locations over time. Makes me wonder if the Zone itself is alive.
Strelok's stories about Agroprom are legendary. They say he made it through the labs, evading mutants and military patrols alike. The guy's a ghost.
Most stalkers steer clear of the marshes, but I've heard whispers of artefacts worth a fortune out there. If you're lucky—or suicidal—you might get rich.
Be on your guard. The military doesn't take prisoners here, and neither do the mutants.
Ever heard about the gas leaks in the underground labs? They say breathing that stuff in will mess with your head. Some stalkers never make it out the same.
Yantar's not far from here, and neither is the Brain Scorcher. That proximity alone makes Agroprom one of the most dangerous places in the Zone.
The anomalies here aren't just deadly—they're unpredictable. A clear path one day could be a deathtrap the next.
Some loners talk about forming a proper base here, but with Duty and the military at each other's throats, it's only a matter of time before someone gets caught in the crossfire.
The swamps have always been a Bandit playground. If you don't keep your head on a swivel, you're as good as dead—or worse.
There's a rumor that Strelok's PDA had notes about Agroprom's labs. The military's been hunting for it ever since.
Watch out for the Bandit patrols near the marsh. They've been known to ambush loners heading toward Yantar or the Garbage.
Whatever's underground here, it's worth dying for—or killing for. The labs are a treasure trove for those who can survive them.
Don't let the quiet fool you. Agroprom is one of the deadliest places in the Zone, and not just because of the military presence.
Heard about the mutated dogs in the marsh? They're faster and meaner than the ones near the Cordon. Stay sharp.
Sssh. Did you hear that? I don't think we're alone down here.
I've heard that bandits like to creep around down here. We should be ready for surprises.
What do you even need to do in these tunnels? I feel claustrophobic already.
Some of the older stalkers tell stories about this place. If you believe them, Strelok has a hideout down here somewhere.
I came down here once before. Left the moment the boxes started to float too. I'm no coward, but there's no need to put yourself in danger is there?
Careful. I hear that between Duty, Freedom, Mercenaries, and Monolith, this place can be a warzone at times.
Stalkers talk about this place like it's the doorstep to hell. When you realize the Barrier is the only thing separating this place from the Red Forest, you start to understand why.
Damn Geiger counter! Seems like the further north we go, the harsher the radiation gets. You think people just keel over the moment they lay eyes on the CNPP?
Brother, I hope we never have to cross through here at night. If being a faction battleground wasn't bad enough, I don't want to see what mutants skulk around here in the dark.
Some buddies of mine always said that Freedom rarely stayed sober because of something beyond the Barrier. Do you think it's true?
How can there be so much open sky and things still feel oppressive.
It's... so quiet. I want to shout just to hear something.
Look at all those empty rooms. Think the cultists sleep in there?
Nothing here except mutants and zombies.
This is practically the heart of the zone. Except for maybe the generators I guess.
Okay, we're at the edge of the world here, so time to act like it. We didn't come this far to die like tourists.
I knew a few guys who wanted to make an expedition to this part of the CNPP, before the Brain Scorcher went back online. They never returned. We don't want to end up like them.
Nowhere to go but north, Stalker. Just remember, if we slip up here, we're dead. No funny business, no time to waste, and no shortage of Monolith that want to kill us.
You don't have cold feet, yeah? Good. Listen, we got this. All the shit we've been through has added up to this moment. Come on, get moving.
This is the view we see from everywhere in the Zone? Shit, not bad, not bad at all, man. Still, keep your hands on your gun, this place is dangerous.
Ah, Cordon. We have to start from somewhere, right? Now that I think about it, how did you even make it into the Zone anyways?
Hey, I think we should avoid the bridge. Don't give me that look. I don't have the greatest streak with the military to be honest.

If I had to judge from the PDA chat logs, the car park sees its fair share of skirmishes. Bandits and Loners are constantly fighting one another to lay claim to it. I bet it gives the soldiers watching from the bridge a good laugh.

Rumor says the Cordon is in Sidorovich's palm. It's the only reason why the Military hasn't blown up the rookie village with their helicopters. Do you really think that one man can be powerful enough to keep the government at bay?
If you ignore the mutants and the occasional skirmish with Bandits, the Cordon is actually nice.
There it is, that infamous factory. I think it may have been used to build and repair vehicles - before the Soviet Union fell. Now it's nothing more than a den for murderers, thieves, and liars.

You know, many stalkers speak about the old laboratory hidden here. They say there are others throughout the Zone. If people really took such great measures to hide them, I think it says much about what they were used for. Maybe it's best they were left forgotten?
Bandits call this home. I wasn't surprised to learn they have a hard time keeping a leader around for very long. Though, some believe that's going to change with Sultan running things.
Really? Here? Some rookies fortunately don't last long enough to die in Dark Valley. I hope you came prepared, my friend. This area is dangerous...

Finding shelter from an Emission in Dark Valley can be tricky. It might be a good idea to learn which places are safe for us. I'd prefer not having to shoot my way into a building with the storm at our backs.
Stalker, are you sure we need to travel through here? I remember others saying that there are few places to protect if an Emission were to hit...
Hey, have you heard that people have sometimes been vanishing here? No body, no PDA, nothing. It's strange. I'm not superstitious, but some really believe that this place haunted.

Many avoid travelling through this place if they can. Darkscape is vast, stretching on for miles. I don't think we should continue unless you're sure we have enough supplies to last us the whole trip.

The good thing is that very few stalkers bother travelling through this area, it's huge. The bad? More mutants are likely to roam the land. Not enough people travel this place to keep them in check. Keep your weapon ready, and your eyes sharp.
I think we should try and make it through the valley before nightfall. Maybe try checking some of the cars? If we're lucky, one of them might have enough fuel to make short work of the journey.
Be careful here my friend. The Dead City is anything but.
The Mercenaries have a base here, but between the mutants and the anomalies, that might be the least of our concerns.
I heard they call this place Dead City because of all the zombies. If I see anything looking at me from a window, I'm shooting.
Are we here to try the lotto? Aslan gave me a pistol once. Saved my life with that thing. I'll have to tell you the story sometime.
We should finish our business here and leave as soon as possible. What if the mercenaries decide to claim our patches?
Ever wanted to glow after drinking water? My geiger counter is going crazy everytime I look at those puddles.
Exploring an abandoned hospital in a mutant filled zone. There are at least three horror movies about this.
Oh, you know, just some Monolith, lethal radiation, horrible mutants, dangerous anomalies, and generally everything in the Zone that has the potential to kill us! Wonderful. Why are we here, again?

This is where the firefighters in the Chernobyl disaster went to get treatment. Their sacrifices haunt this place, Stalker, as does the radiation on their clothing. Do not touch the water unless you want to end up like they did.
I can't ever imagine this place being used as anything but a Monolith stronghold today, much less a hospital. Needless to say, I don't think we should stick around here for long.

If you're hurting for gear, you could always try the flea market near the Rostok checkpoint – to the north. Keep in mind that a lot of different stalkers pass through. One too many shootouts have broken out between Bandits, Loners, Duty, and even the occasional Military squad.

I hope you brought your Geiger counter. Years ago, the government buried tons of radioactive junk here - back when the power plant first went up in flames. If that wasn't bad enough, others think it's partly to blame for the mutants that roam the area.

We should be careful if we near the train hangar. It's supposedly a safe haven for stalkers, but that often depends on who is camping there. I'm sure Butcher has witnessed his share of gunfights when an Emission hits.

Just between you and me, I paid for this tip. If there's a blowout to happen we can find shelter in the basement of the flea market. It's also a safe spot to rest the night if you don't want to spend the evening roaming about.

To the north you'll find Rostok – Duty's stronghold. Agroprom is to the west, the Military's base of operations in the Zone. Heading east you'll find Dark valley where the Bandit's somehow scrape together a living in that miserable corner of the Zone.
Do you think any stalkers have ever made it here before? I mean ones that aren't part of Monolith.
If you told me I'd be coming here, I might have decided to stay in the south. Even the wind feels hostile.
What are those... orbs of electricity? Some kind of machine? To what end.
Strelok came here, didn't he? What kind of a person comes to the heart of the zone and leaves unchanged.
We'll be legends for sure if we make it out of here. Everyone talks about reaching the center of the zone, but how many people actually do it.
We'd best be careful if we're to travel through here. It'll be difficult to spot mutants hiding in the reeds and bushes.
Legend says that Clear Sky was founded in the far fringes of the swamp. How they managed to survive in this armpit of the Zone between the mutants and the anomalies is beyond me.

Not the worst place in the Zone, but it's close. With the Renegades having such a heinous reputation, there are few other places more fitting for the damned fiends. There is comfort in knowing the swamps will sort many of them out sooner or later.

This place... it scares me. I've heard stories of bloodsuckers ambushing stalkers, quickly bursting from the water to strike and dragging their victims underwater. There was this one where some foolish tourists thought to camp overnight in the open. Their bodies were found days later in their torn sleeping bags, half-eaten by boars with very little blood to be found, caught by surprise in their sleep...

string_table.string: _ This land is a vast and dangerous maze. But there are landmarks to help us navigate the area. There are a few watchtowers, the old church, the pumping station, the fishing hamlet, and the burnt farm. You can easily tell where the machine yard is if you watch the Military's helicopter sweeping the area from above.

string.text: I don't think I've ever felt so exposed in the zone before. Look at all this open space.
Don't let how peaceful this area looks deceive you. Bloodsuckers in the north. Zombies in the west. An abandoned minefield. At least the Train station is relatively secure.
Let's stay far away from the AA Complex. I don't think I've ever seen so many zombies in one place before.
The Scientist bunker here is a good place to hunker down in an emission. Good views of the area around it as well if they let you climb to the top.
The trader in the station is loud, but at least they're friendly. If we're looking for a safe place to rest, there's not much better in the north.
Remind me why we're down here again? You know there are guides that avoid this place.
Do you have spare batteries? I think mine are almost dead.
Dark, full of gas, and crawling with mutants. Just in case you thought the zone wasn't dangerous enough on the surface.
They say Strelok used this path to get to the center of the zone. Think he left any stashes behind?
My geiger counter is acting weird. First it's clicking non-stop and then it goes silent. I'd keep that mask on if I were you.
Every expedition team the Ecologists sent to X16 never returned alive, but we're no ordinary expedition team, eh?

Remember, Stalker, underground areas like this are irresistible to snorks, and I'd imagine whatever horrible thing that's creating this psy-field hasn't left them alone, either. Do not let your guard down.
Take some psy-block. We have no idea what's in this place, and if that psy field outside is any indication, this place isn't going to be nice on our senses.
God, I got a splitting headache! The hell is this place? Crazy eggheads. I'm gonna try my best to watch your back, but I got the creeps here.
Moaning. Guess that's what happened to those expedition teams. They're probably not alone, either, you got something to kill mutants with?
Ugh, that smell. It's like a death truck, but worse.
I'm telling you, that box just moved by itself.
So many dead bodies. What happened here?
I think I can hear anomalies further in. Be careful and keep your eyes open.
If we make it out of here alive, no one will believe us.
Okay! Fun's over, get your ass moving and turn that damn thing off before our brains get fried like eggs!
I'll watch your back, you get this fucking thing disabled before the Monolith reinforce this place!
Agh! Fuck, my ears! Go, go for fuck's sake! Turn this goddamn thing off before we end up like those fanatics do!
Stalker, I hope you didn't cheap out on Sakharov's technological crap, because we don't have time to wait around here! Get going!
Move, move! We don't have time, Monolith are coming to reinforce and this psy-field is gonna turn our brains to paste!
How did you even find this place?
A secret lab under a service center? I suppose I've seen stranger.
What the hell is this place?
Keep track of where you came from. These labs are always a maze.
What kind of research needs this level of secrecy?
It is said that while many try to brave the journey through Limansk, Monolith lies waiting in ambush with traps...
Empty, filled only with ghosts and death...

Limansk... it doesn't appear on any official maps. The Soviet Union had a habit of building secret cities and towns far removed from the world. This may be one such place. But, if so, what purpose did it serve?
Word has been circulating of a path not affected by the Brain Scorcher, that many have fought and died trying to secure such a path for themselves. Could this be it?
I swear, the farther north we travel the more I can feel something picking away at my thoughts. Am I being paranoid? Maybe the stories are getting to me after all.
This place, it's... beautiful.
I never thought I would ever find a place this peaceful in the Zone. It... reminds me a little of home. What was your home like, stalker? Before you came here?
They call this place the Meadow. I wonder why nobody has claimed this little village or the depot for themselves?
One of the few places where we could probably rest or sleep without much worry.
If I had to live the rest of my days in the Zone it would probably be here, in this little village.
We fight through a bunch of tunnels and find a creepy altar. What the hell is this?
At least the voices are quieter here.
What are these controls for, the Zone?
I can still hear movement, be ready for a fight.
Think the engineers who built this place thought this would happen?
There's damage, but this place looks new still.
I've got the strangest feeling. It's like we're being watched.
All these doors are locked. What treasures could be hidden here?
Careful, don't touch anything, what if you set off an alarm?
It's safe from the storms outside, but why does this place exist at all?
It's one thing to hear about it... Entirely different thing to witness it yourself. So many buildings, abandoned. God rest their souls.
Not much to find in the Outskirts except mercenaries and Monolith. Still, it's safer than being in Pripyat.
Before the Zone was formed, stalkers would trespass here to loot old buildings of the belongings left by past residents. Imagine aiming that small nowadays.

It's strange how many stalkers know so little about the history of the Zone before it became anomalous. Pripyat was built by the USSR to house the workers at the CNNP. Supposedly it was quite prosperous as a city. What a waste.

If you were here a week after the Chernobyl disaster and had no radiation protection... Christ. You know what the liquidators did, right? Dug up the radioactive soil and buried it with uncontaminated dirt. There's still lethal patches of radiation here, courtesy of the Zone; but if it wasn't for them, this entire place would be more uninhabitable than it already is.
Fifty thousand people used to live here. At least they managed to evacuate before the Zone decided to get all weird.
So many windows, who knows what could be looking at us from the darkness.
The city is infinitely quieter than it ever used to be. Now, the only sounds that break the silence are gunshots and mutant calls.
Do we really need to be here? Rumors say the monolith base is here somewhere.
Was that? No, nevermind, I think I'm seeing things. Keep your eyes open though, looks like a nasty place to be caught off guard.
If I am being honest, I never thought I would have traveled this deep into the Zone when I first arrived.
Are you prepared to die here? Monolith scouts lie waiting, picking stalkers off. Then there's the mutants. They're notoriously horrid here.
I'm not feeling well... I think there's a leak in my mask. The PDA logs spoke of spiking radiation levels in this area.
Why does the skies seem more foreboding as we go north?
A great test for many stalkers. Years ago, Duty and Freedom fought one another here trying to reach Pripyat.
Many seasoned stalkers believe that this forest is cursed, avoiding it by any means if they can.
Have you heard the stories about this place? Even the most hardened stalkers of the Zone fear it.
My friend, we should tread very carefully. It is well known that the many who have dared to travel the Red Forest never return. One can only imagine what happened to them...
Did you notice it as well? Even with a mask the air is heavy with the taste of metal, of rust.
Something... is off. This place feels like it is from some sort of dream.
So long as you're on good terms with Duty and the Loners, they say Rostok is a nice place to kick up your feet and unwind.

Like them or not, I think many understand Duty's cause. Somehow, someway, the Zone will take more and more from you until you've nothing left but pain and hatred. Still, Duty would have an easier time if they weren't pricks about everything.

Many stalkers who've yet to build a reputation in the Zone complain about Duty's thorough checkpoint inspections. The rookies probably don't know that questionable figures have snuck serious explosives through the checkpoints in the past. It was a mess...
No matter how many Duty kills, those damn dogs keep showing up to harass stalkers. It must hurt Bartender's business when a wild pack drags some trader or tourist into a ditch and tears them apart.
Ah, at last! After what we've been through, I could use a drink. Let's visit Bartender and celebrate! What do you say?
Our grandfathers built this place, and now it's the biggest Monolith stronghold in the Zone... Whatever, come on and let's get this done.
Holy shit, and I thought the X labs were creepy and cramped, the hell is this place?

This place was originally meant to contain Chernobyl's radioactive wrath, now it contains the wrath of the Monolith. I shouldn't have to say this, but keep your gun ready, we got no idea how many will be here.
That voice? You hear it too? Shit, man. Just keep moving, we got a job to do.
The Sarcophagus is mainly comprised of tunnels and small rooms, if I was to guess. Do not get complacent, death lurks everywhere.
The military sometimes patrol here. Maybe some of these old vehicles still work?
I hope you have eyes in the back of your head. The mutants know how to sneak up on you using the wrecks.
There's one good thing about this place. Plenty of cover from the storms.
A friend of mine used to hide out in one of the towers here. Claimed that it was safer than being on the ground because nothing could sneak up on him.
If we have to pass through here, can we at least stick to the edges? Stalkers have made some camps in the west and south before, they should be relatively safe.
Between Freedom, Mercenaries, Bandits, and mutants; they've kept Duty from pushing out and claim more of the manufacturing plant.
I overheard some stalkers talking about a downed helicopter here. If we find it, can we take a moment to look at it? I've never seen a Hind up close. Maybe I might be able to climb inside?
A veteran once said that Wild Territory gives most new stalkers a taste of what the Zone is like further north, but it probably differs from one stalker to the next.
I was browsing the PDA logs and it seems that Mercenaries insistent they have a presence here. Why? What could they possibly want with Wild Territory?

It's common knowledge the underpasses here are filled with anomaly clusters. Unless you're wanting artifacts, I think we should avoid digging around. Many stalkers have died trying to navigate through them.
We're not going near the plant are we? I don't think I have enough psy-blockers.
The walls around the bunker are thick enough to make even a paranoid stalker feel safe. Maybe it's time for a rest.
I've heard there's a lab inside the plant somewhere, I wonder what secrets it holds.
I've heard a rumor that the mercenaries know a path to Dead City somewhere in the north of this place.
If it wasn't for all the gas, that little lake would be a good place to relax.
I don't think we really appreciate how lucky we are that the ships aren't radioactive.
The Ranger Station is a frequent site of shady deals and firefights. I suppose the safety of its walls draws all sorts.
Radioactive water, mad hermits, mutants and anomalies. What's not to love about Sunny Zaton.
The Mercenaries are often found in that pumping station in the south. I wonder if there's something special about it, or if they just like the way it smells.
A Military helicopter crashed here a while ago. I wonder if its been picked clean yet or not.
I'll cover you!
Reload, I got you!
Reload faster damn it!
Reload, quick!
Covering you!
Don't waste time—reload now!
I'll keep them off you, hurry up!
Reload, stalker! Don't get caught empty!
Covering fire! Reload while you can!
Make it quick, we're not safe yet!
Reload your weapon, don't stop now!
I've got your back—reload and focus!
We're exposed here—reload faster!
Reload! I'll cover your flank!
They're closing in! Reload before it's too late!
Reload and aim true—we can't afford mistakes!
I'll keep their heads down—reload now!
Faster, stalker! Your life depends on it!
Reload and keep firing, we're not done yet!
Reload now! We've got them pinned!
Don't freeze up—reload and fight back!
Reload your gun, stalker! They're not waiting for you!
They're pushing forward! Reload and stay sharp!
Stop fumbling and reload, we're sitting ducks here!
Reload! Don't let them get the upper hand!
I'm holding them off! Reload while you can!
Reload, stalker! The Zone doesn't wait for anyone!
Quick, reload! They're regrouping!
Reload your weapon, I've got your six!
Get your gun loaded, they're coming in close!
Keep your gun clean damn it!
Fuck! Covering you!
Fix your fucking gun!
Damn it! How hard is gun maintenance?!
You are never hearing the end of this!
Shit! Your gun's jammed? Fix it quick!
Fuck, your weapon's jammed? I'll cover you!
Not now! Clear that jam, we're in deep shit here!
Your gun's jammed? Move! I'll handle it!
Jammed again? Damn it, I told you to check your gear!
Fix it fast, stalker! We can't afford this delay!
Fuck's sake! Your gun's down? Stay behind me!
Zone help us! Clear that jam before we're overrun!
Seriously?! Gun maintenance isn't optional!
Keep it together! Fix that jam or we're toast!
How the hell did you let your gun jam now of all times?
Your gun's jammed? Then use your knife if you have to!
Fucking great, a jam in the middle of a firefight!
I'll hold them off! Fix that jam before it's too late!
What did I say about checking your weapon? Fix it, fast!
Fix your gun, stalker! This is the worst time for a jam!
Fucking jams! How long do you need?
Damn it, get that gun working or we're dead!
You really trust that piece of shit rifle? Fix it now!
Move, I'll cover you while you sort that out!
This is why you oil your weapon, stalker! Fix it!
Clear the jam or drop it and use something else!
Your gun's down? What are you waiting for? Fix it!
For fuck's sake, not now! Clear that jam, fast!
They're closing in! Get that gun working or we're screwed!
We lost one!
We're getting our asses kicked!
Damn! Should we retreat or fight this one out!?
Shit!
This might be a lost cause!
They're gone! Fuck, we couldn't save them!
Another one down... Zone damn it!
Shit, we lost them! Keep your head in the fight!
No! We're falling apart here!
They're dead! What the hell do we do now?!
We can't let their sacrifice be for nothing! Push on!
Another one bites the dust... this fight's turning to shit.
The Zone's claimed another one... let's not join them!
They're gone, stalker! Stay sharp or we're next!
Fuck! That was our friend, damn it!
Hold it together, stalker! We're not dead yet!
Another one down... the Zone's not done with us yet!
We're losing people left and right! Pull yourself together!
Shit, they didn't stand a chance...!
We're dropping like flies! Do we stand or run?!
They're gone... another victim of this cursed Zone.
Don't let this rattle you, stalker! We've still got a fight to win!
The Zone takes no prisoners... and now it's taken them.
They're dead... Keep moving, or we'll join them!
Another one down... damn it, this mission's cursed.
We're not leaving this place alive at this rate...
They're gone, stalker... we need to focus!
We lost a good one... don't let it be for nothing!
They're dead... the Zone's taking its toll on us...
This fight's gone to hell... we're outnumbered and losing people!
No! Stalker!
He's... he's gone! He flatlined...
Godammit!
I'm getting out of here!
I couldn't save you. I'm sorry...
No! Not like this! You can't die on me!
I will avenge you. Rest easy, stalker.
Why? Why did this have to happen to me?
I'll drink to your memory. I'm sorry.
You were a good stalker, real good. Maybe even the best.
You were supposed to make it... not like this...
I'll never forgive the Zone for this... never!
No! I should have been faster, smarter... Damn it!
The Zone takes another... What a waste...
They got you... I can't believe they got you...
I'll see to it that your name's not forgotten, stalker.
You were one of the best I've ever known. The Zone didn't deserve you.
It's my fault... I should've had your back...
I'll carry your memory with me... and make them pay.
You're gone, but the Zone won't break me... not yet...
You didn't deserve this... none of us do...
The Zone claimed another... Damn you, Zone!
Goodbye, my friend. I hope the Zone's kinder in the next life.
No one escapes the Zone forever... but I hoped you would.
I'll make sure they pay for this. You have my word.
The Zone doesn't care about us, but I cared about you. Rest in peace.
You fought well, stalker. I'll keep fighting for both of us.
Don't worry, stalker. I'll take care of your gear and your legacy.
It wasn't supposed to end this way... Damn it all.
Shit... Who's going to keep me alive now?
The Zone got you in the end... I'll remember you, stalker.
I can't believe this... You deserved better...
We were so close... Damn it! Why did it have to be you?
I'll drink to your memory, stalker... if I make it out alive.
Gone, just like that... I'll keep going, for both of us.
Shit... I told you this place would kill us...
You were the toughest bastard I ever met... The Zone evened the odds.
I'll get through this... for you. Rest easy.
Why the hell did I let this happen? I'm so sorry...
If you can hear me, I'll finish what we started. I swear it.
I can't believe it! That thieving, lying bastard managed to pull the wool over my eyes and now I've no roubles or artifacts!
You were gambling. What did you expect? Hmm? To win big? You're lucky he left you with a weapon with how you were playing. Face it, you suck at cards. What's done is done.
Hmph! He was cheating, I'm sure of it. We will see if he's still smiling tonight, when he wins my knife in his throat.
You'll soon have no luck left to find if others hear you! Shut up already! Idiot. There's always another artifact.
Come on, tell us already. What was the strangest anomaly you've seen in the Zone? I heard you've been here for some time, right? You must have a story to tell.

Fine! Fine. I'll tell you if you leave me to my drink, pest. *sigh* Once, I was following this team of Ecologists thinking I could earn some money. They found this strange patch of... large floating flowers.
Flowers? The strangest thing you've seen is flowers? Pfft.

Shut it! Nothing is ever as it seems here. They had an eerie glow about them, roots gnarling through the air. One of the sorry souls tripped into the flowers and then the others fled in fear. It all happened so fast. After they were gone, I took a closer look. The suits the eggheads wear? They are almost airtight. All that remained of the scientist sloshed around in a yellow suit, like… a soup. Not a single bone to be felt when I prod at it with a branch.
We should have buried them. It feels wrong having left them there like we did. It was... the least we could have done.
And what? Waste our last moments of precious daylight digging? We would've been ambushed by mutants or stalkers soon after night fell. There was little time for us to waste.
You don't know that! Vulture! You were quick to take their things and run when you had the chance.
Don't raise your tone with me, bastard! I am not going die grieving over stalkers who get lazy or careless. This is the Zone - it doesn't care about these things. You'd best accept that.

I'm telling you, I'm not crazy. I watched with my own eyes as a bolt of lightning struck it during the storm. It came to life! I could only watch in disbelief, rain pouring while the truck vanished into the woods.
Death trucks. They travel throughout the Zone, filled with the corpses of fallen stalkers and driven by ghosts. Nobody knows why they roam so.
Legends claim that they are driven by death itself, ferrying the souls of the wicked and greedy into the gates of hell itself.
Hah! Bullshit! I heard some drunkard spewing wild stories that the trucks will take you to the Wish Granter if you give them enough artifacts. No stalker has the balls to go chasing after one.
Didn't one of Sidorovich's men find the Marked One near an overturned death truck?
Listen, most people come here to get rich. If they want a yacht on the seaside, this is the way to it. But I didn't come here to get rich. I'm here to a pay a debt.

Don't give me that shit! What kind of debt requires delving into the Zone? You could have paid it off in the city and spent the rest of your days living. I think you chose to be here, just like everyone else.

This was different. I fell in with some bad people, did some dark deeds. But I fucked up a job — a big one — and they weren't going to let me off the hook. So... they took her. My Olena. They told me the only way I would get her back is here, in the Zone, after I've made them rich.

I... I am sorry. Whatever you did before is none of my business. But I know that no one should have their love stolen from them. You've been a good friend to me. After all of this is over, I can meet you, and together we can kill these pricks.
You guys ever get doubts?
The hell you mean?

I mean, like, why are our stupid asses in the Zone anyway? You ever think about it sometimes? I don't know, sometimes my PDA pings and it's like more shit after another. Some guy kills himself, another guy gets cancer, some other guy's dog dies or something, Jesus. This place is taking a toll on us.
Well, I'm here for the Zone, same as you and everyone we find. I know the risks. Suck it up.
Tch, alright.
Greetings, stalker. Don't mind us, just relaxing by the fire.
Not talkative, are you?
Would you be? Come on, take a look at him, guy's seen some shit.
Yeah... Yeah, you got a point. Come relax with us, man, enjoy a drink or two for the fallen.
Amen, brother.
Alright, alright, settle down, rookies. You want a damn story? I'll give you one.
One day, I was doing my shit, you know? Odd job for some stalker, wanted me to get a package from his dead buddy's body. I didn't ask questions, why would I? Get it and get out, I'd done it before.

This time felt a bit off, though. Moment I stepped foot in the Garbage, I got this tight feeling in my chest. You know that feeling, the one you get before a blowout? That, but worse, and more sudden. I didn't think much of it, why would I? I've had that exact feeling before.

I got to where he said his body was, a clearing in the grass. He had a Sunrise suit on, he was surrounded by dogs and chewed to pieces. I tried looting him, and I don't remember what happened, but I blacked out and woke up in Cordon covered in mud, piss, and blood, my backpack looted, my helmet broken and my PDA missing.
According to my friends, I was just gone for a week. No trace, no blip on the PDA, erased from existence for 7 days until I woke up. God only knows what happened in that time, because I don't.
This sounds like bullshit, man.
It's the Zone, you've heard weirder.
What's the weirdest job you got from a trader?

Shit, Sakharov. That guy always has some crazy jobs. He bugged some mutant and asked me to kill it. Apparently he didn't want to tell me that that mutant was a Pseudogiant. To this day I got no clue how he even managed to get that tracker into it. You?

Shit, do you one better. Ever get paid to kill someone's doppelganger? There was this stalker who came to Butcher in a damn panic talking about how there was some guy who looked, talked, and acted just like him following him through half the damn Zone!
Why didn't he just shoot him?

No clue, maybe it didn't feel right shooting himself in the face. Either way, Butcher told me to do it. Killed him, took off the guy's mask, lo and behold, his face was identical to that poor guy that went to Butcher. PDA had the same name registered to it as well. Zone's fucking weird, man.
Shit, sounds like it.
You know, this whole damn place has an underbelly of western trade.
No shit, that's where our artefacts go.

Yeah, but not in that way. Me and some boys were out in Cordon doing some stuff for a trader, you know how it is. Suddenly, the Ukrainian army starts shooting at us. We aren't even close to the damn blockade and they started firing the moment we were in sight. We took cover, some hotshot with his rusty Mosin nailed a few jarheads, and next thing you know we're on to looting this military blockade before anyone realizes what happened.
What'd you find?

You won't believe it, man. Packs and packs of western cigarettes, snacks, MREs, coffee, alcohol, magazines, books, tents, ammo, supplies. You name it, they had it. Entire crates full of this shit, all with English labels.
Shit, what'd you do with it?
Took the best shit, burned the rest.
Burned? Why?

There'd be nothing for the reinforcements to salvage after if we burned it. Worked pretty well, supposedly some military guys surrendered in Rookie Village about a week later because they had no supplies left and were desperate. Heard they got shot by the loners there.
You got any of that stuff left?
Ha! You got any of your roubles left?
Fuck you, man.
BOOM! Headshot!
Fuck yeah! Headshot!
Headshot! How is that guy still standing?
Headshot!
Love that plink sound when you get a headshot!
Right between the eyes!
One shot, one kill. Beautiful.
That's what I call precision!
Another one bites the dust—head first!
Bullseye! That's how it's done!
Pop! Goes the weasel!
Direct hit to the brainpan!
Clean shot to the dome!
That'll shut them up for good!
Painted the walls with that one!
Aim small, miss small. Nailed it!
That's a cranial ventilation system installed!
Boom! Skull cracker!
That head's not walking it off.
Zone's best marksman right here!
Heads up! Oh, wait...
Lights out, forever!
He won't be needing a helmet anymore!
One shot to the noggin! Classic!
Perfect aim! Right through the skull!
What a beauty of a shot!
Dead center. They never stood a chance.
Clean shot to the thinker!
Brain-buster! Nailed it!
Headshot, stalker-style!
Whew. Looks like we made it through.
Remind me to buy more ammo next time we see a trader.
That was close.
Things were looking rough for a second there.
Clear! Keep your eyes open though, that might change at any time.
All clear, at least for now.
Nothing moving... for now. Stay alert.
The Zone's quiet again... I don't trust it.
Well, that's one less problem to worry about.
We're alive. That's good enough for me.
Clear! But don't let your guard down.
All quiet now... too quiet.
We made it... somehow.
They're dead, but don't get comfortable. The Zone loves surprises.
Not bad, stalker. Not bad at all.
Good work. Let's keep moving.
The Zone's calm... for now. Let's not waste it.
Clear! Let's loot and get the hell out of here.
It's quiet now. Let's not stick around to change that.
Nice shooting, stalker. That could've gone worse.
They're down. Let's hope there's no reinforcements.
All dead. Keep moving before more show up.
Clear for now. Stay sharp though.
We made it. I wasn't sure we would for a second there.
Zone's mercy, we're still alive. Barely.
Clear! Time to reload and regroup.
They're not getting back up. Good riddance.
That's one fight I don't want to repeat anytime soon.
The air's quiet again. Let's not waste it.
We did it. The Zone's still ours for now.
All clear... but stay close. I've got a bad feeling about this place.
Let's move before the Zone changes its mind.
We're still breathing. That's something.
Good shooting, stalker. You've got skills.
Everything's still for now. Keep your weapon ready.
That's how you handle business in the Zone!
They're all dead. But for how long?
Clear. The Zone's mercy is rare—don't waste it.
Looks like we're in the clear. For now...
The Zone gave us a pass this time. Don't count on it again.
We're still standing. That's a win in my book.
Clear for now. Let's not waste time.
That's how you survive the Zone. Good work.
They're down, but this fight's far from over. Stay alert.
The Zone's quiet... for now.
Whew. Thought we were goners there for a second.
Nicely done, stalker. Let's move before something else shows up.
All clear! Time to catch our breath.
We're good... for now. But keep an eye out.
Nothing left but corpses. Let's keep moving.
This place has a weird beauty about it, doesn't it?
Stay sharp. You got my back, I got yours.
My dogs are barking.
Skin a crow, find a joint.
My legs ache, shit.
Just two stalkers in the Zone, minding their own business.
Ears open. If a mutant is coming, I'll shout.
Why is your gun cooler than mine? No fair.
You smell that? Shit, is that you?
Good friends are hard to come by, stalker. Glad I'm one of the lucky ones.
Hey, hey, that's mud! Wait, this is all mud. Dammit.
You got any family? ... Alright, touchy subject.
Hey, if I die, don't let my shit go to waste, yeah?
Only thing worse than a mutant is a mutant at night.
Wonder why you never see any kids here? What? Just an observation.
Fucking cold, man.
There's Ukraine, and then there's the Zone, man. Normal rules don't apply here.
You see anyone you think is hostile, shoot first and ask questions later.
Junk, junk, more junk, grass... Wow, this place is barren.
I need a smoke.
The Zone is alive, always be on your toes.
Please, God, don't step in front of my line of fire, okay?
Mutants scare me, man. If I can't shoot straight at them, that's why.
Ah, the radioactive air, how lovely.
Whatever you do, don't touch the water.
If this shit gets any crazier, I'm applying for a desk job... in Pripyat.
Ever wonder if the Zone laughs at us? I mean, we're basically her playthings.
If you hear me scream, don't laugh. Mutants are fucking terrifying.
Goddammit, why does everything here smell like wet socks and burnt rubber?
Got any vodka? No? Well, fuck me, right?
I heard some rookie pissed on an anomaly and lived to tell the tale. Lucky bastard.
If I die, tell my stash to go fuck itself. I'm not sharing.
Sometimes I think the Zone's just a really elaborate joke by God.
Heard a story about a stalker who found an artefact that cured hangovers. Probably bullshit, but a man can dream.
If a bloodsucker shows up, I'm not fighting it. I'm running. Don't judge me.
My suit's ripped, my boots are wet, and my balls are freezing. Living the dream, eh?
Next time someone says “easy job,” I'm punching them in the throat.
Don't get attached to anyone in the Zone. The Zone has a way of taking everything you care about.
Wonder if mutants fuck? What? It's a valid question.
If this was my last cigarette, I'd be pretty pissed right now.
You ever see a controller up close? Hope to God you don't. Shit's nightmare fuel.
The Zone doesn't give second chances. Remember that.
I once saw a pseudodog eating another pseudodog. No idea why that stuck with me, but it did.
If we make it out of here alive, drinks are on me. Unless I'm broke. Then they're on you.
This place will kill you slowly if you let it. I'd rather go out with a bang.
You'd think I'd get used to this place. Nope, still scares the shit out of me.
Heard there's a place deep in the Zone where the sky bleeds red. Let's not find it, yeah?
If we find artefacts, you're splitting them, right? Right?
I'm not saying I hate the Zone, but if it was a person, I'd punch it in the face.
If you hear a snork, shoot it in the face before it gets too close. Trust me.
This place is a dump, but hey, it's our dump.
Ever wonder what would happen if someone nuked the Zone? My money's on it just getting angrier.
If we find a stash, I'm calling dibs on any cigarettes in there.
Once met a guy who claimed to wrestle a chimera barehanded. He was missing both hands. Go figure.
There's nowhere else like the Zone. And thank God for that.
I'd kill for a hot meal right about now. Hell, I'd kill for a warm meal.
Look, I'm not scared, alright? I'm just... strategically cautious.
They say the Zone messes with your head. Pretty sure my head was fucked before I got here.
Keep your eyes open and your gun loaded. This place loves catching you off guard.
